Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 05:13PM tfox03 wrote: Well, I just got my results! Everything looks fine.  I'm so relieved. I go for my follow up on Friday! I was so worried... thanks for all the kind words. I know I'm not "out of the woods" yet, but am so happy about my pathology report!

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 03:50PM tfox03 wrote: She told me I would have them today, but her office called a bit ago to let me know they didn't have them yet. I'm thankful they called, even though they didn't have the results yet. It makes me feel like I'm not forgotten :) I'm worried because of the dark color of the discharge.  I've been reading some of the topics today, and notice some reference a "clear" discharge. Mine is really dark, brownish red and was very noticible and very frequent. Even so much as staining the sheets. My family history isn't the best, so I'm a little concerned, to say the least. My aunt had both breasts removed, and another died from ovarian cancer. I guess my family "gene pool" isn't the greatest.... I'm trying to stay positive...... I just wish they would call with the results......

I've always been kind of a loner, and very independent, so this is kind of tough.... not having family near me. Thank  you so much!

Posts.Content: tfox03 wrote: I had my biopsy done last week and waiting on test results. The surgeon said the procedure went well, but it all seems like a blur at the moment. My mammogram didn't show any lumps, but I had a dark bloody discharge. I wasn't worried in the beginning, even though the thoughts of "bloody discharge" doesn't put a smile on anyone's face.... Is anyone else familiar with this symptom, course of treatment? As you can see, I am very naive and would appreciate anyone's input on this subject. Log in to post a reply
